abstract: Formed in 2002, Reunion.com is already coming up on its fifth anniversary. But the company, which runs a Web site for former schoolmates to get in touch with each other, only just announced its first round of venture capital funding, a $25 million slug from Oak Investment Partners. Red Herring describes Reunion.com as a social networking site in the Web 2.0 camp, like the much more popular online hangouts MySpace or Facebook.
lead_paragraph: Formed in 2002, Reunion.com is already coming up on its fifth anniversary. But the company, which runs a Web site for former schoolmates to get in touch with each other, only just announced its first round of venture capital funding, a $25 million slug from Oak Investment Partners. Red Herring describes Reunion.com as a social networking site in the Web 2.0 camp, like the much more popular online hangouts MySpace or Facebook.

headline.main: Reunion.com Connects With Big Funding Round
